channel.title: NPR Topics: News
channel.description: NPR news, audio, and podcasts. Coverage of breaking stories, national and world news, politics, business, science, technology, and extended coverage of major national and world events.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: Americans are struggling to pay off credit card debt; Tiny Desk Contest's 2024 winner
item.description: Nearly 1 in 5 Americans have maxed out their credit card borrowing, according to the Federal Reserve Bank in New York. Tiny Desk Contest crowns its 10th anniversary winner.
item.content:encoded:
Nearly 1 in 5 Americans have maxed out their credit card borrowing, according to the Federal Reserve Bank in New York. Tiny Desk Contest crowns its 10th anniversary winner.

(Image credit: Justin Sullivan)
item.dc:creator: Suzanne Nuyen

item.title: Two new novels investigate what makes magic, what is real and imagined
item.description: Both of these novels, Pages of Mourning and The Cemetery of Untold Stories, from an emerging writer and a long-celebrated one, respectively, walk an open road of remembering love, grief, and fate.
item.content:encoded: Both of these novels, Pages of Mourning and The Cemetery of Untold Stories, from an emerging writer and a long-celebrated one, respectively, walk an open road of remembering love, grief, and fate.
item.dc:creator: Marcela Davison Avilés

item.title: How Israel's military investigates itself in cases of possible wrongdoing
item.description: Since last October, complaints have included Israeli soldiers firing on unarmed Palestinian refugees and the killing of World Central Kitchen aid workers when Israeli drones fired on their convoy.
item.content:encoded:
Since last October, complaints have included Israeli soldiers firing on unarmed Palestinian refugees and the killing of World Central Kitchen aid workers when Israeli drones fired on their convoy.

(Image credit: Menahem Kahana)
item.dc:creator: Rob Schmitz

item.title: Target scales back on its LGBTQ+ merchandise ahead of Pride Month 2024
item.description: In a statement to NPR, a spokesperson for the retail giant says it is committed to supporting the LGBTQ+ community year-round, not only during the month of June.
item.content:encoded: In a statement to NPR, a spokesperson for the retail giant says it is committed to supporting the LGBTQ+ community year-round, not only during the month of June.
item.dc:creator: Jonathan Franklin

item.title: Most of South Dakota's tribes have banned Kristi Noem from their land. Here's why
item.description: For Noem, "every state is now a border state" including her own where she says some tribal leaders are benefiting from drug cartel activity.
item.content:encoded: For Noem, "every state is now a border state" including her own where she says some tribal leaders are benefiting from drug cartel activity.
item.dc:creator: Lee Strubinger

item.title: Aldi and Hy-Vee stores recall cream cheese varieties for possible salmonella risk
item.description: There have been no reports of negative reactions as a result of the recall, the FDA said last week. The products should be thrown away, or returned to either an Aldi or HyVee store for a full refund.
item.content:encoded: There have been no reports of negative reactions as a result of the recall, the FDA said last week. The products should be thrown away, or returned to either an Aldi or HyVee store for a full refund.
item.dc:creator: Ayana Archie

item.title: There's usually no need to panic when planes make emergency landings. Here's why
item.description: Planes make diversions — also called "emergency landings" — all the time. Almost always, everyone on board is fine. Here are some reasons why.
item.content:encoded:
Planes make diversions — also called "emergency landings" — all the time. Almost always, everyone on board is fine. Here are some reasons why.

(Image credit: Stephen Brashear)
item.dc:creator: James Doubek

item.title: Why children with disabilities are missing school and losing skills
item.description: A special education staffing crisis is raging through many U.S. school districts. It's taking a toll on students and families.
item.content:encoded: A special education staffing crisis is raging through many U.S. school districts. It's taking a toll on students and families.
item.dc:creator: Cory Turner

item.title: Lots of drug companies talk about putting patients first — but this one actually did
item.description: When Amylyx Pharmaceuticals found out its ALS drug Relyvrio didn't work, the company took the unusual step of voluntarily pulling it off the market.
item.content:encoded: When Amylyx Pharmaceuticals found out its ALS drug Relyvrio didn't work, the company took the unusual step of voluntarily pulling it off the market.
item.dc:creator: Jon Hamilton

item.title: Why the trope of the 'outside agitator' persists
item.description: As protests continue to rock the campuses of colleges and universities, a familiar set of questions is being raised: Are these protests really being led by students? Or are the real drivers of the civil disobedience outsiders, seizing on an opportunity to wreak chaos and stir up trouble?
item.content:encoded: As protests continue to rock the campuses of colleges and universities, a familiar set of questions is being raised: Are these protests really being led by students? Or are the real drivers of the civil disobedience outsiders, seizing on an opportunity to wreak chaos and stir up trouble?
item.dc:creator: Shereen Marisol Meraji
